data.title: mark
data.meta_description: MARK translate: die Deutsche Mark, die Note, der Fleck, die Markierung, das Kreuz, das Anzeichen, markieren…. Learn more in the Cambridge English-German Dictionary.
data.text:
noun

/maːk/

●

a point given as a reward for good work etc

die Note

She got good marks in the exam.

●

a sign used as a guide to position etc

die Markierung

There’s a mark on the map showing where the church is.

●

a cross or other sign used instead of a signature

das Kreuz

He couldn’t sign his name, so he made his mark instead.

mark

verb

●

to put a mark or stain on, or to become marked or stained

markieren

Every pupil’s coat must be marked with his or her name

That coffee has marked the tablecloth

●

to give marks to (a piece of work)

benoten

I have forty exam-papers to mark tonight.

●

to show; to be a sign of

anzeigen

X marks the spot where the treasure is buried.

●

(in football/soccer etc) to keep close to (an opponent) so as to prevent his getting the ball

jemanden decken

Your job is to mark the centre-forward.

(Translation of mark from the PASSWORD English–German Dictionary © 2014 K Dictionaries Ltd)

Examples of mark

mark

They also mark a move away from the old subsidy-based approach.

Sie markieren auch eine Abkehr vom alten Subventionsdenken.

They also mark a move away from the old subsidy-based approach.

Sie markieren auch eine Abkehr vom alten Subventionsdenken.

This crisis is marked by widely diverging views on the instruments to be used.

Diese Differenzen sind insofern von Bedeutung, als sie die Trennlinie zwischen Krieg und Frieden markieren.

This crisis is marked by widely diverging views on the instruments to be used.

Diese Differenzen sind insofern von Bedeutung, als sie die Trennlinie zwischen Krieg und Frieden markieren.

These examples are from corpora and from sources on the web. Any opinions in the examples do not represent the opinion of the Cambridge Dictionary editors or of Cambridge University Press or its licensors.
